The facetious comments, you know, some of them over the line, but I just don't think it's worth the time.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes, I think we all agree on that.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I mean, President Trump makes crazy statements.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No, really not. I've never heard that argument.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Not in that same way. President Trump though teasing a big announcement coming up at the Coronavirus Task Force briefing. In the meantime, stick around for the "FASTEST SEVEN."

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.utterance: Welcome back. The White House Coronavirus Task Force briefing is set to start at any moment. While we wait for that, it's time for the "FASTEST SEVEN." First up, the coronavirus pandemic has gyms closed and people confine to their homes. So naturally, we're all worried about ways to stay fit and healthy in isolation. Now you guys, I am lucky because my best friend happens to be an amazing fitness instructor. And she's been doing all of these like amazing online classes for free. I put it on my story on Instagram if anyone wants to go and check her out. Dana and Greg, however, I have a feeling that you guys have a certain bike apparatus at home that's been keeping you busy.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Wait a second. No one is supposed to know about that.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I'm so glad I got the Peloton. We only talk about it every day. I'm so glad that I have it because I just checked. I wasn't just looking at my phone. I -- 768 steps today in five floors, even though I don't carry my phone with me up and down the stairs. I mean, if I didn't have the bike, who knows what would -- I don't know what I would do. I'm going to go for a walk after the show though.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You know what?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I'm going to go get some fresh air. I need a break.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I'm not worried about weights. The only thing that keeps growing is my hair. I have to get a haircut. So we have no hair and makeup here. I'm doing my own makeup which is why I look like -- I don't know, I look like George Hamilton.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: It looks pretty good.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I look like I should be -- I look like Robert Culp from like 19 -- from the I spy era. I look like I should be hanging out at the Playboy Mansion hitting on girls who are like 18. I look like I should be selling Lamborghinis on Beverly drive. And the hair is just insane.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Greg, should I tell people what you said about the makeup in the greenroom?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Sure, go ahead. I don't care.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Greg says he likes doing his own makeup.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I do because it makes me feel pretty.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: He says he enjoys it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's therapeutic because you can't -- you can't think about anything but putting stuff on your face, and so that kind of like --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Greg likes doing his own makeup.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, I do.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That's the headline, everybody.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I'm man --

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.utterance: I think that's great.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I'm man enough to admit it.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.utterance: Exactly. I think that's great.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: What movie was that?

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.utterance: Let's get to topic two. Oh -- next up with sports shuttered around the country, people are finding all kinds of other things to bet on, like how many times President Trump will say these words at the Task Force briefings.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: And we're doing tremendous work. Incredible. Fantastic job. Amazing. Tremendous. Amazing. Incredible. Fantastic.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.utterance: All right Juan, what is your money on? Have you been making those bets?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: No, I think people have a lot of disposable income and they got a lot of energy and nothing to do with it because there's no sports around. So, I think you know, if you have to -- if it's entertaining, it's fun, go for it. Do whatever you can. Although I guess, with the high rate of unemployment we've seen, you got to be careful about that money for a lot of people but I think it's fun. By the way, when it comes to exercise, I've been doing the walks with my wife and she's been doing my makeup so high five to the wife. And the other thing is, I discovered a high school track yesterday so I ran a mile on the track which was surprisingly open. I was -- I was so pleased. And the other thing is bottles of water that are used for the water fountain in my house, I now use those as weights.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Oh, very good.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.utterance: Oh, that's smart. That's like prison-style, Juan. Jesse, what about you? Have you been --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Well, I just got the bow flex. You know those little like units and you dial it and you can work out like that. So I'm getting pretty --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Peter got that.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.utterance: I didn't know that still existed.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Also, we got those little ab rollers where you get on your knees and you roll out.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No you don't.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: And then you roll in. Oh, yeah, they're working like a charm. The gains are unreal. Also, I got these little like handlebars for the push-ups so you can go down really deep. You guys aren't even going to recognize me in few days.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I hope so.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.utterance: You guys, on the other side of this, we're all going to be like awesome prison buddies. All right, we are awaiting an update from the White House Coronavirus Task Force. Stay with us. In the meantime, "FAN MAIL FRIDAY" is up next.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: "FAN MAIL FRIDAY," we're answering your questions. First one from Genevieve. That's a great name. What movie and or TV shows are you watching now that you have to stay home? That's a good question. Dana, what are you watching?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Well, we just finished watching Wild, Wild Country on Netflix. It was a documentary about a --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: A sex cult. It's about a cult.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes. in Oregon.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Dana, a sex cult in Oregon.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: It was not scandalous.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: If it's about a sex cult, Greg has seen it.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: But you know what?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, Dana, but --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: The FBI was fabulous in that. The FBI was great.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, there was -- Rajneesh, right?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: But I watch -- I watch that. And then last night, we just called friends. Rajneesh, yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, got it. What about you, Juan? What are you watching?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: I'm watching -- I guess it's on Netflix. It's called Gentefied. It's about Latino family in East LA. They run a taco shop but the neighborhood is changing and they're having to make changes to try to attract new customers. But it's a real interesting look inside a family's life. And then we watched a rom-com which was like my five favorite boyfriends or something. And I actually, you know, in these tense times, I enjoyed it. I was like, I don't need you know, Bruce Willis jumping off a tower right now. I'm just like, let's have some you easy times on the couch, you know.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I could tell you, if you're saying it's speaking good of romantic comedies, you've -- you got to get outside, Juan. Emily, what about you?

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.utterance: OK, so I am revisiting the entire Twilight Saga.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Oh, my God. No.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.utterance: Yes. And also -- yes, yes. I love it. And then --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Seriously? Twilight? It's my favorite.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.utterance: Yes. You guys. I always -- I always talk about this. You shouldn't be surprised.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You guys.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.utterance: And also, we are watching The Outsider, Stephen King's on Netflix or whatever which I think we're kind of late to the game but obviously that makes me terrified which is why I have to balance out also with the Hallmark Channel.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. Jesse, what are you watching?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Em and I are Julia Roberts phase right now. So we've watched Pretty Woman and Sleeping With The Enemy.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That's interesting.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Say it. Just say it.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I don't know what to say. I'm watching just old Chuck Heston movies, because that's what I always -- I'm watching the Omega Man. Remember Omega Man, Planet of the Apes, Soylent Green. Those are good movies for this time. They start eating each other at the end. Anyway, that's not going to happen with America. We'll be back to work before we get that bad. All right. Are you enjoying -- this is a great question. Are you enjoying social distancing more or less than you thought you would and why? What about you, Jesse?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: My life hasn't changed that much to be honest with you. I really - - I always kind of hung out at the apartment and prepped for the show, and worked out, and came in to work in the afternoon. So --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Prep? You don't prep. By the way, you know what you like about this? You have fewer people throwing things that you on the subway.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That is true. And I will never take the subway again after this.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. And an excuse not to come in early.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Emily, do -- are you --

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.utterance: I loved it --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Go ahead.

utterances.speaker: COMPAGNO
utterances.utterance: I loved it way more than I thought I would. But I like deeply, deeply miss my family and that like physical connection with them. But that being aside, I totally love it. I just feel like the world is quiet and I spent all my time outside with the dog when I can so it's kind of bliss.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Juan, do you like it more than you thought you would? Your way for me.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.utterance: You know, no. Hey look, I tell you, I think human beings are social animals. I think we thrive on it and ideas pop and you know, sometimes you have disagreement. But you know what, I'm just a social animal. And I also think that it's interesting, I find myself like being told don't go near that person. I'm like, but I want to see them. I just want to talk or I miss the grandkids, obviously. I miss my family. You know, one daughter in law's the doc, so we can't go near her, that kind of thing. I don't like it that on that level.
